tool.name: ENM_Process

param.name: in_features
param.dialogReference: File of CSV type containing information of decimal latitude and longitude, species name, and year.

param.name: xy_tolerance
param.dialogReference: Value used to define tolerance of overlapping data points. Used in rarifying the data.

param.name: split_percentage
param.dialogReference: Decimal value used to split the provided data into testing and training sets. Number entered will be used as the split value in the training dataset, the remaining will be testing.

param.name: buffer_distance
param.dialogReference: Value used to define distance used to create buffer mask for all point values.

param.name: distance_unit
param.dialogReference: Define units used throughout the process, units will remain constant across all functions that are used to prevent mismatch.

param.name: raster_folder
param.dialogReference: Location of folder containing rasters of ecological information.

param.name: occurrence_folder
param.dialogReference: Folder containing the data for occurrence points. Folder is also used to store various shapefiles and CSV files created through the process.

param.name: mask_folder
param.dialogReference: Folder used to store the mask raster used to create the masked ecological bias rasters.

param.name: ascii_raster_folder
param.dialogReference: Folder used to store ascii rasters created during process.

tool.summary: This tool takes point data in csv, cleans it, and converts it to a shape file. Once completed the points are used to create buffer and mask shapes to process BioClim rasters, and provide a finished set of masked rasters in .tif and .asc format..
